fields.description:
When a user imports a Trello Board into Jira as a Business Project, the user gets added to Developers Project Role.

Please enable the functionality, so that the importer_user gets added to the Administrator Project Role instead of Developer.
fields.summary: The importer_user from Trello to Jira should be added as Administrator Project Role instead of Developers role

fields.description:
Is there any option for you to add a CNAME or other alias for your DKIM DNS names? They conflict with another prominent remailing service’s entry. Having many customers establish mailing subdomains to get mail sent from your system to deliver properly seems much more intrusive than having an alternate name set to offer to solve this issue.

Basically, What I am asking is if you would consider adding an alias to the existing record providing 2 options for what a customer can set in their DKIM DNS entries to point to to validate the signature. Ideally, if you added something like s3._domainkey.atlassian.net CNAME to s1._domainkey.atlassian.net and s4 to s2. That should resolve the existing conflict with sendgrid entries that are required to properly deliver Pagerduty and other service emails. Maybe that change would break validation in the DKIM verification chain but it doesn’t seem like it would. It should also not affect anyone using current settings or configurations
fields.summary: add CNAME/alias for DKIM names

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since the system fields can be removed from screens (summary, assignee, reporter) even they are still shown they can't be set. So, the end-user has no idea why it is not editable even they can see it. This affects the issue creation, if the summary field is not on the screen you can't create issues using the shortcut ( + ) in the boards/backlogs. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove Summary Field from the screens. Let's say subtasks' screens.
 # Try to create new subtasks using the ( + ) option. 

h3. Expected Results

Fields such as Summary, assigned, reporter must be blocked and added by default to the screens. 
h3. Actual Results

Summary, assigned, reporter can be removed 
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Block system fields in screens

fields.description: The deprecated /rest/api/2/workflow call returns metadata that indicates lastModifiedDate and lastModifiedUser. This metadata is not available in the replacement paginated /rest/api/2/workflow/search. This is important information when trying to run reports against the state of the Jira configuration. Even if it is not returned by default, it should be an expand option.
fields.summary: New paginated Workflow REST call needs to return metadata

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
You can edit the name of a gadget by selecting rename in the menu options, this works changing the complete name or using the arrows of the keyboard but clicking on the part that needs to be edited does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a dashboard, or navigate to an existing one
2. Find or create a new gadget for filter results
3. Click the meatball menu on the gadget > rename
4. Click into the title to rename

 [^Gadget rename BUG.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Be able to edit the part where you click on it 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Workaround
You can use the arrows of the keyboard to navigate to the desired part.
fields.summary: Not able to click and select which part to edit when renaming a gadget in a dashboard.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating issue security of an existing issue through the REST API, the issue history shows the opposite and shows it is set to none. The security level is assigned to the issue but the issue history shows it wrong.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Set the security level of an issue using the REST API
 * Check the issue history

h3. Expected Results

The Issue history shows the security level as to the required one.
h3. Actual Results

The Issue history shows the security level set to "None".
 !Screenshot 2020-04-27 at 6.42.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Setting Issue security through API shows the security level cleared in the issue history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Desk instances' users are not able to search for people in the People and Teams directory.

Typing in the search field will no return any results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a JSD only Cloud instance;
* Access https://<your instance>.atlassian.net/jira/people/search;
* Attempt to search for other users.

h3. Expected Results

The search will return the results according to your search input.

h3. Actual Results

No results are retrieved.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk only instances' users are not able to search for other users in the People and Teams directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to send an email to the user from <instance>/secure/admin/SendBulkMail!default.jspa. Then project roles does not reflect on the project selected from the send email option. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access to <instance>/secure/admin/SendBulkMail!default.jspa
 # Select the project and try to send a email to project role within the project. 
# An error "The chosen project/role combination(s) have no members." shows up from the screen. 

h3. Expected Results
An email generated to the intended users. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
Error " The chosen project/role combination(s) have no members." display from the screen and multiple entries display from the email option. 
h3. *Note* 
The project roles does not show the correct entries based on the project selected. 
h3. Workaround
One of the entries for the project role is the valid one. So trying this out by going through the list will trigger the email eventually.
fields.summary: When sending email based on project role, the project role does not reflect on the project selected.

fields.description:

 * Access the history tab of the issue in the new issue view.
 * You will get 'Something gone wrong' error.
 * However using the old issue view, one can access the history tab without any issues. 

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in Chrome developer tools when history tab of a ticket with date picker field is accessed in new issue view.
{noformat}
TypeError: Cannot read property 'format' of undefined

at index.js:56

at cu (react-dom.production.min.js:246)
at uu (react-dom.production.min.js:246)
at eu (react-dom.production.min.js:239)

at t.unstable_runWithPriority (scheduler.production.min.js:19)
at Ho (react-dom.production.min.js:122)
at Yo (react-dom.production.min.js:123)
at Ko (react-dom.production.min.js:122)

fields.description:
*Problem*
At this time search engines such as Google are indexing site meta tags and we can't control the content being indexed by those engines.

*Suggestion*:
It would be nice to have the option to control what is being indexed or improve the current content indexed by search engines.

fields.description:
There are only three roles for Next-gen project (*Administrator*, *Member*, and *Viewer*), as shown on the documentation below:
* [Manage how people access your next-gen project |https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/manage-how-people-access-your-next-gen-project/]

It would be helpful for the Administrators if they could grant some user the *Moderator role*, where they could handle the people access inside the project, but without having other administrative privileges.

fields.description:

It can be confusing sometimes when changing the timezone as the drop-down list doesn't display all the options unless the filter is utilized. For example, if you select Europe and the click on the arrow to display other options, only Europe will be displayed.

Normally, the drown-down list would display all the options, and users would be able to scroll through them and filter at the same time.

fields.description:
*Summary:*

Currently, it's not possible to have different screens for a different user just like how a user can have different screens for different issue types

*Suggestion:*

Provide the ability to control which screens can be viewed by which role/group/user
fields.summary: Allow different screens for different users

fields.description:
*Bug* - 

Link a google document to a Jira issue and save it. Press Ctrl + click on the link.

*Expected behaviour -* It should open in the new tab.

*Actual behaviour -* It would end up opening in the same tab.

This behaviour is specific to a windows machine and is not replicable on Macbook. This is issue was replicable from Support's end as well.

fields.description:
Currently, the majority of the add-ons installed on the cloud site, show up in all the projects. Very few add-ons provide options to enable/disable based on the user or project. This produces a very cluttered issue view screen for the sites that have a large number of the plugins installed.

It would be very handy if the site-admin or project administrator has the option to enable/disable the add-on per-project level.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to enable/disable add-ons per project level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user is mentioned in a comment and they receive notifications on their notification panel. If they click on the issue that is linked to the notification, they are redirected to the issue but in Old Issue View even though they have New Issue View enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get mentioned in a comment by another user
 # On the notification panel, click on the issue link provided in the notification

h3. Expected Results

The link should direct the user to the issue in New Issue View
h3. Actual Results

The link directs the user to Old Issue view and adds "?focusedCommentId=10029&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-10029" to the URL
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking on Issue link on mention notifications leads to Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Scenario
We are using Jira Cloud API for our integration at Guidewire (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/). We have an issue with the attachments uploaded to a Jira issue. The attachments uploaded to a Jira issue generate three webhook events - _issueupdated_, _commentcreated_ (in the case of public attachment) and _attachmentcreated_. In our implementation scenario, we are integrating with Salesforce and the requirement is to only bring the public attachments from Jira to Salesforce. As we understand from the webhook behavior, if an attachment is public, it will have a corresponding public comment created.

h3. Problem
The three webhook events are independent of each other and are not correlated.
The _commentcreated_ webhook event has only the attachment name and no other attachment metadata. So I cannot get the attachment id from _commentcreated_ webhook to perform a subsequent get attachment details API call to get the attachment link.

The _attachmentcreated_ webhook event has only attachment details like id and link but does not have visibility details. It does not have the comment id to which it is associated and hence we are not able to get the visibility of the attachment based on which comment it is associated with.

The _issueupdated_ webhook event does not provide any attachment detail or comment detail or any other detail correlating the attachment and the comment to which it is associated with.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Include all the attachment details to the webhook events, such as comment id, attachment id, comment visibility and etc...
fields.summary: Include attachment metadata on issue updated webhook events

fields.description:
|*Atlassian Update - 1 April 2021*|
|Hi everyone,
 Thank you for your feedback on this ticket. Based on your feedback, we have identified this ticket as high priority. Although we cannot commit to dates at this time, the display of Trello cards on the new issue view (through the Jira Power-Up extension) is on our short term roadmap. Please watch this ticket for updates. 
 
Thanks
The Atlassian Cloud team|

 

You can install a Jira Power-Up (extension) in Trello and you can refer to Jira issues in Trello cards.

When you do it, in the old issue view it's added a section called "Mentioned in" which shows the link to the Trello card, but this is missing in the new issue view.

As a Jira user, I was to be able to see the 'mentioned in' section related to Trello in the new Jira issue view.
fields.summary: 'mentioned in' section related to Trello is missing in the new Jira issue view

fields.description:
Our Primary objective is to communicate between external customers and Jira software users.

Following are the functionalities we need to cover.

1) Email sent by external customers to create backlog in Jira software (We have achieved this by creating automation rule to copy the Service desk ticket into Jira software backlog)

2) Comments/attachments sent through email by customers must be updated in Jira backlog (We have achieved this by creating automation rule to copy the Service desk ticket comment into Jira software backlog, but attachments are not getting copied)

3) Comments/attachments in Jira backlog updated by users must be sent to Customer's email. (Here comment section is working, but attachments are not being copied)

Please let us know how we need to proceed to achieve the working of attachment part.

Since this is a basic requirement, Please suggest a working solution for this. Please suggest a workaround if other customers are facing a similar s
fields.summary: Communication between customers and jira software users

fields.description:
Currently the users on "Your work" tab can see issue summary of projects they do not have access to. Although they can only see what they originally saw before the permission was revoked , it would be nice to not to allow them from viewing the issues altogether to which they do not have access to.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to a group A
 # Grant group A to view project A
 # Get the user to create a test issue, comment on issue edit to fill in the "Worked on" page
 # Remove the user from group A
 # Try to access project A, you won't be able to.
 # But when the user visits "Your work" page, under the "Worked on" tab, the user can still see the issue summary
fields.summary: Users should not be allowed to see issue summary on "Your work" tab to which they do not have access to anymore.

fields.description: In line with the announcement of a native application for Jira Cloud on macOS ([https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/jira-cloud-app-for-mac]), a native PC app would be great to see.
fields.summary: Native PC app for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Nextgen projects with custom filed type “label”, it will not display the default created labels but when you add a label from an issue (A) then it will display labels on other issues (B)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field type Label and add default values
# Go to an issue and click on the custom field for the labels dropdown (it will not display any value)
# Within the dropdown create a new label
# The created label on the issue will now be viewable on all issues instead of the default created labels.

h3. Expected Results
Default created labels should be viewable on the custom field label.

h3. Actual Results
It will only display the labels created from an issue.

h3. Workaround
Add needed labels from an issue so it can be displayed on all issues that use the custom field.
fields.summary: Nextgen - custom field type "Label" will not display default labels

fields.description:

When Deleting a Project the error  "Project <key> is not live" appears

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete Project

h3. Expected Results
Project Deleted

h3. Actual Results
Error "Project <name> is not live" 
!Screen Shot 2020-04-22 at 2.28.54 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. The Development Team has already Flagged this as a Critical Bug and will be rolling out a fix shortly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After executing a site-import for JIRA the activity located at the "Your work" section is not updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a site backup
# Do a site-import
# Open the "Your work" page at: {noformat}https://{instance\}.atlassian.net/jira/your-work{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The Worked on details should display the recent issues you worked on based on the import data.

h3. Actual Results

The page still displays the information form the old projects/issues that might no longer exist due to the site-import. No information from the new data is pulled.

h3. Workaround
--
fields.summary: Your work section is not updated with imported data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When creating a request from an email, Jira Service Desk will render symbols in the email body such as stars ( * ) and the number sign ( # ) as bullet points or a numbered list in the request description.

In some cases, this will render as a long sequence of bullet points or numbered lists, making the description field very large, for example when an email contains a disclaimer surrounded by stars in the signature.
{noformat}
***************** Disclaimer text *****************
{noformat}
h3. Suggested Solution

Administrators should have an option to disable rendering text as markup in incoming emails.
h3. Workaround

Edit the request description in the old issue view to remove the symbols or break the formatting.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to disable rendering symbols as markup in incoming emails

fields.description:
*Feature* - Adding a feature for user list export that should give the date when the Jira admin reactivated the user

Though this is available in audit logs but adding it to UM export would help
fields.summary: User re-activation information should be added under user management

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 20th April 2021}
Hi everyone,

Good news! This bug has been resolved, which means using the ‘jira.permission.createclone.denied’ workflow property no longer removes the _Create subtask_ quick-add action from the new issue view. Go ahead and try it out, and let us know if you have any problems.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
h3. 
Issue Summary

The workflow property 'jira.permission.createclone.denied' gives the ability for users to block the clone creation. When it is set in a status in the workflow, the Clone option is removed from the issues.

However, this is also removing the button to create Subtasks in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to your workflow and add this property to a status and publish
 # test with an issue the clone ability

See the issue reproduced [https://cl.ly/4eadad3f6cbd]
h3. Expected Results

The Clone option is no longer available in the issue menu, as expected.
h3. Actual Results

It is also no longer possible to create subtasks.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Using the workflow property 'jira.permission.createclone.denied' also disables the Subtask creation button
Add support for cascading select list fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Issue search function for filters, JQL, Dashboard, etc... Jira displays results when using the *startOfDay()* function based on your account's time zone that is set under the Account preferences of your Atlassian account.

This poses a problem for teams collaboration across the globe as the results of their Issue searches will differ from one another do to the timezone difference.

For example, a filter that uses the *startOfDay()* function will display fewer Issues for the team in New Zealand than for the team in Amsterdam using the same filter because New Zealand has a 10h+ headstart on the following calendar day.

h3. Proposed solution

Jira should have an option to use the system default timezone when using date related JQL functions. This will allow all users regardless of their timezone to get the same results, consistently.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can create a separate filter for the teams and adjusting the JQL to compensate for the differences in hours.

Using New Zealand and Amsterdam as an example, there is a 10-hour difference.

* Amsterdam filter: {{createdDate >= startOfDay(-1d)}}
* New Zealand filter: {{createdDate >= startOfDay(-34h)}}
fields.summary: System timezone option for Issue search

fields.description:
In new navigation, UI doesn't show the "App navigator" custom links section unlike in Old navigation.
 Screenshot attached for New Navigation and Old Navigation respectively.
h3. Actual experience
 # Click on the Atlassian switcher menu (the nine-grid icon in the top left part of the nav)

h3. Expected experience

A feature would really be helpful to maintain data not just on Jira but offline as well.
fields.summary: Ability to include custom properties in user management export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Link Confluence Page* on the new Jira issue view only browses for Confluence pages that you have access inside your site, not external sites linked via application access.

If we switch to the Old Jira Issue View, we can link Confluence pages from external sites.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an application link to an external site with Confluence Cloud.
 # Open any issue using the new Jira issue view.
 # Search for pages using the *Link Confluence Page* button.
 # The *Link Confluence Page* field will only search for Confluence pages inside the same site, it will not search for Confluence pages of external sites linked via application link.

h3. Expected Results

The *Link Confluence Page* on the new Jira issue should also search for Confluence pages of external sites linked via application link.
h3. Actual Results

The *Link Confluence Page* on the new Jira issue should only search for Confluence pages inside the same site.
h3. Workaround
 # Change to the old issue view.
 # Select *** (right side button at the top of the issue's view page)
 # Select Link.
 # Select the Confluence page.
 # Enter the external Confluence page URL address OR
 # Select search for a page.
 # Select the external server.
 # Search for the page.
fields.summary: Link Confluence Page should also browse for Confluence pages on external sites connected via application link.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating an issue on a project if an image is added to the Description field it gets a thumbnail size making it impossible to review the image. If the image gets added after the issue is created to the same Description field the image has a normal size.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and add an image to the description field
 # Save

h3. Expected Results

Image from Description field must be added as normal review size

h3. Actual Results

The image gets added as a thumbnail 

h3. Workaround

Edit the issue created, delete the current image and re-add back.
fields.summary: Description field creating issue gets incorrect size

fields.description:
Deleting an inactive workflow should refresh the page and redirect the user to the previous area of the page.

By default, the workflow list page has the *Active* workflows expanded and *Inactive* collapsed. Often, users expand the inactive section to delete a workflow or make changes to them. After making such changes, the page is completely refreshed and it requires the user to expand the *Inactive* section again and look for the area in which they were before the page refresh. This can get tricky with a big list of inactive workflows and in a "clean up" situation.

An option would be to save the exact spot the user was in before the action and upon page refresh, take the user to that state.
fields.summary: Making changes to an inactive workflow should refresh the page and redirect the user to the previous area of the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using square brackets in the file name will cause the generated link to be broken after upload.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an attachment with square bracket (" [ " & " ] ").
 # While commenting on an issue, upload the attachment.
 # You will see the link is broken as shown in *_Actual Results_*.

h3. Expected Results

!Screenshot 2019-08-12 at 7.05.16 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot 2019-08-12 at 7.04.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
 * Even though the link is broken the file is successfully attached.

h3. Workaround

*+Workaround 1+*

Use the New issue view

 

*+Workaround 2+*
Use another markup syntax but escaping the square bracket with a backslash symbol:
{noformat}
[filename to be displayed by escaping the square bracket | link to the file by copy-paste from the attachment section] 
{noformat}
Example:
{noformat}
[some file with \[square bracket\].msg|http://baseURL/secure/attachment/12345/some%20file%20with%20%5Bsquare%20bracket%5D.msg]{noformat}
fields.summary: Using square bracket in file name will cause the generated link to be broken after upload

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There are several documented REST API endpoints regarding being able to make changes to workflows documented such as
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-group-Workflows]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-workflow-transitions-transitionId-properties-put]
 * and several other endpoints

However frequently it is documented that:
{quote}Note that active workflow schemes cannot be edited.
{quote}
For example [Set workflow for issue type in workflow scheme PUT /rest/api/3/workflowscheme/\{id}/issuetype/\{issueType}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-workflowscheme-id-issuetype-issueType-put]

So while you can make changes to workflows via the REST API, you can only do this to inactive workflows and drafts. Further complicating the problem here is that there is no mechanism currently to activate AND/OR publish that workflow so that these changes can actually take effect via REST. 
 Users have to currently login to Jira's web interface and publish/activate these changes.
h3. Suggested Solution

The REST API should have some means to activate inactive workflows, and publish workflow drafts.
h3. Why this is important

For the sake of ecosystem integrations that want to be able to make changes to workflows, this is an important ability.
h3. Workaround

Currently users have to login to the web interface of Jira as an admin in order to activate or publish these workflow changes so that they can take affect.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I want to be able to publish drafts and activate inactive workflows to make changes via the REST API

fields.description:

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-21 at 14.23.00.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display the "Issues in Epic" progress bar based in estimation instead of status in the Epic view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when creating an issue, the issue description editor is using the old Jira syntax, rather than the new Markdown syntax used everywhere else.

For example, one has to use the \{ code } tag to put code in, rather than the 3 backticks ```

Allow users to configure the screen to have which type of editor or implement the editor directly.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:

Currently, when a user filter the issue in the filter result gadget and configured linked issue as one of the fields to be displayed from the gadget, The link field will only display the link but not the linked issue statues (Clone, blocked and etc..) from the gadget, 

h3. Suggested Solution

Show the linked statues alongside with the link

h3. Why this is important

It will help to identified the linked issue statues

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to show the linked issue status from the filter result gadget

fields.description:
Issue - Some users have reported that while trying to select the user in custom fields, they are getting this error: *Could not find usernames: <Name>*

The behavior is reproducible when the field is restricted to a single user. We also noticed that this happens on the create issue screen for new issues however if tried to update the same custom field for existing (already created issues) it works fine.

[!_thumb_46650.png|thumbnail!|https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/secure/attachment/46650/46650_Screenshot+2020-04-21+at+12.38.10+PM.png]

Switching to old issue view/new issue view not helping and both the cases are related to the *next-gen project*. The access level is open for the project.

Support is also able to replicate the same at test instances

fields.description:
As of now, the Pages feature in JIRA only supports Confluence Cloud. 

 !image-2020-04-21-17-09-54-529.png|thumbnail! 

The feature should also work with Confluence Server after a successful application link is established. This way users with Confluence Server will also be able to utilize the feature without being forced to subscribe to Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performing a Search from specific issues and when using the Status filter it does not show the issues according to the Status alphabetically
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for specific issues
 # Select the Status top Filter

h3. Expected Results

Issues must be sorted accordingly to the status alphabetically
h3. Actual Results

Issues get sorted with not a logical order:

!image-2020-04-20-18-38-21-795.png|width=840,height=422!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issues status does not sort alphabetically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If Jira has the default language set to a different language than the user profile, the event names are displayed in the default system language in workflow Post Functions instead of respecting the user language preference 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Jira settings > System > General settings*
# Click *Edit settings*
# Select a different option than English in *Default language* (Portuguese, for example) and click *Update*
# Access a project and click *Project settings > Workflows*
# Click the pencil icon next to the workflow name
# Click on one the transitions and click *Post-functions* in the left window
# Click the pencil icon to edit the "Fire a XXX event"

h3. Expected Results

The name of the events are displayed in the language set in the user profile

h3. Actual Results

The name of the events are displayed in the default system language

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 5.45.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Event names are displayed in the default system language in workflow Post Functions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the eventual deprecation of usernames, before this policy the old comments have usernames, however, the new comments have accountIds. It is expected Jira translates old comments with unused usernames and generates the EntityXML from the backup option with only accountIds.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # To have old comments before username deprecation.  
 # Generate a backup of Jira
 # Explore entity.xml and you found usernames and accountIds mixed. 

h3. Expected Results

Align with the lastest unique format: accountIds.
h3. Actual Results

Explore entity.xml and you found usernames and accountIds mixed. 
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: EntityXML in backup must translate usernames to accountIds

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While trying to add a single user to Issue security level does not auto populate the user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any issue security setting
 # Click "Add"
 # Select 'Single user' and try to search for a user.

h3. Expected Results

It should auto populate the selected user
h3. Actual Results

It's not auto populating the selected user.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Single user picker while adding user to Issue security level does not auto populate the user.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When a user sets up an Application Links from *Jira Cloud* to *Bitbucket Server* by using different URLs for *Application URL* and *Display URL/BaseURL*, the error message displayed is misleading. Please refer to the attachment.

Note that *Bitbucket Server* requires the *Application URL* to be the same as *Display URL/BaseURL*. 

Here is the full feedback from the user:

"One feedback I'd like to add, have a look at the attached screenshot - it's the dialog that appears when you add a link. The text there is misleading or confusing. It contradicts what you are telling me about the Application/Display URL being different, and we based our Atlassian migration on what was in that dialog so it's really frustrating right now to learn that it's incorrect information. It'd be good to have that dialog clarified, or perform some validation to prevent different URLs."
h3. Suggested Solution

The above error messages may be applicable when setting up *Application Links* from *Jira Cloud* to other applications. But it is not applicable for Bitbucket Server. Please add extra checking when setting up *Application Links* to *Bitbucket Server*. If the *Application URL* and *Display URL/BaseURL* isn't the same, please display correct error messages.
fields.summary: Misleading error messages when setting up application links to Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
Use case - JQL that returns all issues that have not had any updates for n number of days past the date specified in the custom field value

 

Currently, this is not possible and it would be an incredibly useful feature to be able to trigger events based on the current date, relevant to a custom date field value.
fields.summary: JQL improvements that allow conditional operations

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have a checkbox in my settings that I can check so all stories and task are assigned to me as default. When I create a story or a subtask, provide the option for the ticket to be to be automatically assigned to me (unless the setting is unchecked).

We’re many at work so I have the board filtered to me only, when I create a subtask or story, I have to clear filter, find it, assign to me, put filter back on

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Switching tabs when viewing a child issue changes the issue back to the parent issue and shows it as a child issue of its own in the issue keys on the top left. The summary is still of the child issue and if the user makes any changes on this window the changes actually get saved to the parent issue instead of the child issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a project.
 # Create a child issue in the same issue as above.
 # Click on the child issue to view it in the pop-up window.
 # Switch browser tabs.
 # Return to the Jira tab and check the issue window.

h3. Expected Results

The same subtask is still there on the Jira tab.
h3. Actual Results

The issue key gets returned to the parent showing it as a child issue of its own. Also, the summary is still shown of the child issue.
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Switching the browser tabs on the issue detail view changes the issue being edited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a possible workaround to use custom priority icons, you can upload the desired icon as an attachment to an issue, and use its URL in the priority configuration.

But, currently, the filter subscription email will not be able to display those icons.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Upload an icon to an internal Jira issue, and copy its URL from there (you can do so in the old view);
* Create a new priority, using that URL as the icon;
* Perform an advanced search;
* Set as *Priority* as a column:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-17 at 08.19.59.png|thumbnail! 
* Save the search as a filter;
* Create a filter subscription:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-17 at 08.20.08.png|thumbnail! 
* Trigger the subscription:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-17 at 08.20.14.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-04-17 at 08.20.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The custom icon will be displayed in the filter subscription:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-17 at 08.09.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The icons appear in a broken state, or are not displayed at all:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-17 at 08.09.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Upload the icon to a different online repository, and copy the URL from there.
fields.summary: Custom priority icon stored on a Jira issue will not be displayed in filter subscription

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding files (that are not images) to multi-line text custom fields (the ones that are below the description), is having the field unable to save further changes. A Javascript error happens and changes are not saved.

Happens only with the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a multi-line text custom field and add it to the screens
# While creating (or using the old issue view editing) add any non-thumbnailable file (any file except for images).
# Save the change
# Using the new issue view, attempt to add more text to the field (do not remove the file).
# Save changes

Check the video showing the problem happening: [^multi-line_bug.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Changes are saved accordingly

h3. Actual Results
Changes with the new issue view are not saved and a javascript stack trace appears in the console:
{code}
async-issue-view~atlaskit~6f4eaae6.2822d1480ca3dd360acf.8.js:sourcemap:24 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read property 'content' of undefined
    at e.encode (async-issue-view~atlaskit~6f4eaae6.2822d1480ca3dd360acf.8.js:sourcemap:24)
    at async-editor-view.4c964b3f7039a7752b58.8.js:sourcemap:3
{code}

h3. Workaround
Perform changes using the old issue view. You can disable the new issue view by following the steps described below (not applicable for next-gen projects):

# Click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
fields.summary: Multi-line text fields are not saving changes if they contain media (new issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing the summary of an issue, if we press enter/return, the field keeps showing the highlight box around the field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # On any existing issue, make any change to the summary.
 # Press enter/return to save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

It will save the new summary and the field won't show as selected the same as the old view.
h3. !Screen Recording 2020-04-16 at 03.33 PM.gif|width=506,height=178!
h3. Actual Results

The summary is saved, but it shows as the field is still selected, even if we change other fields after changing the summary.

!Screen Recording 2020-04-16 at 03.19 PM.gif|width=483,height=246!
h3. Workaround


 Click on the  !Screen Shot 2020-04-16 at 15.37.06.png|width=21,height=22! or click outside of the summary (without pressing enter/return).
fields.summary: Pressing enter/return keeps the summary field selected when using the new issue view

fields.description:
A number of times we have experienced the following scenario, typically just after an issue has been created:
1. A support person (SP) enters a new issue including its oringinal description (OD).
2. An administrator/manager (AM) completely replaces a majority of the issue description with a new description (ND).
3. The original support person (SP) makes minor corrections to the description (UD).
The actual result is:
A. The history shows AM updated the description from OD to ND.
B. The history makes it appear like SP reverted the entire description from ND to UD, when in the UI it had actually only experienced a minor change from OD to UD.
The expected result is:
A. The history should show the actual updates that occurred - from original content to revised content. If it's only a minor update, the history should reflect that fact. Such a minor update could be (manually?) applied to a brand new (replacement) description.
Some possible ways this could be improved:
A. A locking mechanism, preventing the description from being updated if another user is actively updating the description. This would presumably be easier that implementing locking for all fields in the issue.
B. Notification of current updates, when the second update is saved. In this case, both descriptions could even be displayed with an option to select which to keep - the one already saved vs. the one currently attempted to be saved.
fields.summary: Improve Concurrent Update For Issue Description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is currently not possible to set a default reporter for incoming email handler.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the incoming email handler page at https://<domain-name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa .
# Click on 'Add Incoming Mail Handler'
# 'Default Cloud Mail Server' for the Server field and 'Create a new issue or add comment to an existing issue' for Handler field. Click 'Next'.
# Attempt to add a user to default reporter. Suggestion list will show but clicking on any of the suggestions will not 'add' the selected user to the default reporter field. Attempting to type the full name of the user to the default reporter and saving changes will result in the default reporter not being saved.

h3. Expected Results
Default reporter should be added after clicking on the user suggestion list.

h3. Actual Results
Default reporter is not added after clicking on the user suggestion list. Attempting to save with the user full name in the default reporter also results in the default reporter value being ignored.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot set default reporter for incoming email handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The project name isn't displayed on the workflow scheme if the project was moved to the trash (recycle bin), but the workflow scheme keeps active.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate a project to a particular workflow.
 # Move the project to trash.

h3. Expected Results

The deleted project is shown in the list of associated projects next to the workflow scheme.
h3. Actual Results

The deleted project does not show up in the workflow scheme admin page, however, the scheme is still considered active and Jira will not allow deletion.

!image-2020-04-16-10-24-05-487.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Due to the high risk of catastrophic accidental data loss, we recommend that you do not try to work around this issue.

If you _really_ want to delete such a workflow, you should move all linked projects to the Trash and then fully delete them from the Trash page.

There is currently no way to figure out which deleted projects are linked to any particular workflow, so you will need some trial-and-error to make sure you get all of them. Alternatively, you may purge the entire recycle bin. *PLEASE be careful* when doing this, as all the data deleted this way is impossible to recover.
fields.summary: Project name isn't displayed on workflow scheme if on trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a duplicate custom field with the same name as another custom field of different type will lead to error in advanced search.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Text-multiline and name it as say "TestCustomField"
 # Now add a context to this custom field with issue type and project.
# Create another custom field of type Select list multiple choice , with same name , say , "Testcustomfield" and add the same context as the previous one.
# Assign these two custom fields to screens in that project.
# Now proceed to search for issues in that project in Advanced search. 
# When you choose the custom field "Testcustomfield" ( which is a select list ) and perform the JQL search , it returns an error stating " *The operator '=' is not supported by the 'Testcustomfield*' field.

h3. Expected Results
It should identify the proper custom field
h3. Actual Results
The search is getting confused with the another custom field with same name which is Text multi line , where it does not support = operator. 

h3. Workaround
* Rename one of the custom field
* Perform advanced search using the custom field ID.
fields.summary: Creating a custom field with same name and context as another custom field leads to error in Advanced search

fields.description:
When inserting a user or team mention in the new issue view, do not insert a space after the username is autocompleted.
----
When mentioning users, we often add commas or other punctuation after mentions, which annoyingly requires backspacing to remove the extra space after the mention.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when a user changed his profile picture privacy to "his organization" according to [Update your profile and visibility settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-968656104.html], Although the user from the same organization can see the user avatar from Jira. But it still shows as initials as the user avatar form the add-on (eg. Tempo Timesheet)

h3. Why this is important

Better efficiency of keep track of the worklog from Tempo 

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability for add-on to respect collaborator privacy settings.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Idling after uploading Image will prevent saving the comment due to timeout/stale session issue.

The error message is wrong and confusing.
{quote}(x) *We couldn't save your comment*
 It might be empty, too long, or have invalid
 formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the
 formatting and adding it directly in the editor.
{quote}
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload file Image in the comment section of New Issue View
 # Leave the tab open for a while 

h3. Expected Results
Able to continue and save the comment

h3. Actual Results
the page will eventually stop letting you upload things (images and video) and when you click to save it doesn't let you save, but keeps it in draft.

Signs that this occurs: If the uploaded image/video flashes gray for half a second with a "retry" button on bottom-left corner - and then shows the preview - that means the time has come, and you won't be able to save that comment. 

The video and image get uploaded broken - they show up in preview, but aren't actually uploaded - and show broken when you click on them to view fully.
 !Screenshot 2020-04-16 at 2.38.43 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
To fix this, just copy-paste URL to a new tab, reupload and save.
fields.summary: Idling after uploading Image will prevent saving the comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users with access to both Confluence and Jira, won't be able to search on Confluence people directory (INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/people/search), in case they don't have *Browse users and groups* permission on Jira Global Permissions.

This doesn't affect users with access to only Confluence.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user on your Instance.
 # Grant Confluence and Jira access.
 # Make sure that the group granting Jira access, is not part of *Browse users and groups* permission (on Jira Global Permissions).
 # Login as user.
 # Access Confluence Home page.
 # Click on *People* (on the sidebar or on the top bar, depending on the navigation version you are using).
 # Try to search for another (valid) user.

*Important:* I wasn't able to reproduce this issue by impersonating an impacted user, just by logging using credentials.
h3. Expected Results

The search should return the users correctly. Although the user doesn't have the permission granted on Jira side, this feature is available on Confluence side. Additionally, our documentation doesn't mention about the need of this permission:
* [Search the People Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/search-the-people-directory-724765425.html]
* [Searching for people and teams|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/searching-for-people-and-teams-976161203.html]

h3. Actual Results
The search won't return the expected results.

h3. Workaround
Add the impacted user to a group that has *Browse users and groups* permission.
To check your Jira Global Permissions:
https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/secure/admin/jira/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa
fields.summary: Confluence people directory search doesn't work for Jira users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 17 June 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

This issue has now been fixed. When an option for a cascade custom field is disabled, this will no longer appear in the list from the new issue view.  

Thanks
Tha Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}


h3. Issue Summary

We have a custom cascading field called Tribe & Squad which we use heavily for our metrics reporting. There are some Squad options that we've disabled in the custom field default context and although those options are correctly disabled in the Jira Old View, however, they remain enabled in the JIRA New View.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *cascade custom field*.
 # *Add* options in the custom field and in each option *add cascade options*.
 # Link this custom field with a screen.
 # *Disable* any cascade option.
 # Open the issue view using the *new issue view*.
 # Check the available cascade options in the custom field.

h3. Expected Results

When selecting the custom field options and checking the cascade options, the cascade options that I've disabled is not appearing on the drop-down list using the *new issue view*.
h3. Actual Results

When selecting the custom field options and checking the cascade options, the cascade options that I've disabled are still appearing on the drop-down list using the *new issue view*.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Disabling the cascade options in the custom field doesn't get any effect in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira's current state, any user with access to a Project is able to export its contents through the Issue Navigator and there is no way to restrict who is able to export Issues.

This means that when you have access to a Project, you can collect all data on every field.

 !Issue_navigator_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Add an additional layer of restriction the *Share dashboards and filters* permission in the [Global Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-global-permissions-776636359.html].

Users without this permission should have the *Export* button hidden.

 !Issue_navigator_-_empty.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Restrict the option to export Issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users try to select a user in the User Workload Report, the autocomplete feature doesn't work and it isn't possible to use the report
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project and add issues to it
 # Log work in some issues
 # In the project's view, click *Reports > User Workload Report*
 # Start typing the name of your user and click the suggestion option

h3. Expected Results

The user is selected and you can see the report
h3. Actual Results

The user isn't selected and you cannot use the report.

!Screen Recording 2020-04-14 at 05.09 PM.gif|width=749,height=385!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Editing the Assignee field triggers issue updated event rather than issue assigned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Remove the users on the issue assigned event on the notification scheme, leaving the issue updated event.
 - Edit the Assignee field and assign it to a user
 - Wait for the notification event on your mailbox

h3. Expected Behaviour

Editing the Assignee field should trigger *Issue Assigned* event.
h3. Actual Behaviour

Issue updated event is triggered rather than issue assigned event
fields.summary: Editing the Assignee Field triggers Issue Updated event instead of Issue Assigned
Cannot create and transition issues using the /rest/api/3/issue/bulk REST API endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We cannot search for the "Status" field ( once its unchecked) from the columns , in search issues page, if there are many custom fields with the word "status" in it.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple custom fields with the word "status" in it. For e.g create multiple custom fields with name AAA status , BBB status, .... RRR status ,RRR1 status, RRR2 status, .. and so on which exceeds more than 25.
 # Now navigate to search issues page and uncheck "Status" from the column filter.
 # Now search for "Status" page again.

h3. Expected Results

"Status" field should be returned
h3. Actual Results

"Status" field is not returned , as the search results only top 25 results.
h3. Workaround

Workaround is to click on "Restore defaults" on the column filters.
fields.summary: Searching for "Status" field on columns does not return the field anymore if there are many custom fields with word "Status" in it.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when a user changed something from the project configuration such as priority changes. Even in the Audit log doesn't have the information. It will be best to know when is the last update and who perform the action, in case there's unwanted update happen.
h3. Suggested Solution

Display more detailed changes in the Audit logs about project configuration,
h3. Why this is important

It will be best to know when there's an unintended change from the project configuration.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Display more detailed changes in the Audit logs

fields.description:
Summary:
 * There isn't any option to remove error message in Slack
 * Eg: When a user with Email A is logged into Slack and does not have access to Jira. However, the user has access to Jira with Email B instead.
 ** The current error message is only pointing that the user doe not have access to Jira which creates confusion.

Suggestion:
 * To add the option to remove the error message in Slack and be specific which email address does not have access to Jira
fields.summary: Ability to remove error message in Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When there are angle brackets in the summary of an issue, the unfurl link gets messed up. See support ticket for screenshots of issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Jira with slack
 # Create a ticket in Jira with angles in Jira summary

h3. Expected Results
It should show the proper embedded URL

h3. Actual Results
It shows results like below:
 !image-2020-04-13-11-05-01-796.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Summaries with brackets don't unfurl properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding a large comment (> 12 lines)/attachemnt in the new issue view makes the comment box be displayed in front of all older comments.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a ticket and view it from the new issue view;
# Post a few small comments;
# Open the comment box and add some lines to it (> 12 lines) or a big attachment;
# Scroll the issue view to look at older comments.

h3. Expected behavior

Older comments will be shown at the top of the comment box.

h3. Actual behavior

The comment box hides the older comments. Please see the video below:
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/QwuKWLj6

h3. Workaround

Use *see old view* option, or disable new issue view in personal settings.
fields.summary: Posting large comments/attachments on the new issue view will hide older comments
Proper sprint object for issues in API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you click on the *Create Backup* in Backup manager page for Jira, the backup will start generating immediately. Then, there will be a 48 hours timer to limit the frequency of backup.

Due to the backup timer is not shown on the UI, you have to click the *Create Backup* button to know whether the backup timer has finished, and if there is a timer, it'll have a message stating that the backup frequency is limited and the backup timer is there. 

However, if the timer has finished, the backup still start again, causing the 48 hours timer to begin. This has caused users to unintentionally generate backup while trying to check the timer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a confirmation pop-up that shows whether the backup is ready to be generated again or there is a backup frequency going on without the trials and errors.
fields.summary: Add a confirmation pop-up before generating backup for Jira

fields.description: I was wondering if we have the ability to archive issues after they are completed? I do not want to remove or delete them. I do not want my project to be cluttered with completed issues.
fields.summary: Is there a way to archive Issues to keep projects clean?

fields.description:
Currently the Jira Cloud REST API has 31 endpoints that allow Anonymous users to extract data from an instance:
||friendly name|| Endpoint || quicklink||
|Get system avatars by type|GET /rest/api/2/avatar/{type}/system|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-auditing-record-get|
|Get avatars| GET /rest/api/2/universal_avatar/type/{type}/owner/{entityId} | https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-universal-avatar-type-type-owner-entityId-get|
|Get all dashboards|GET /rest/api/2/dashboard|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-universal-avatar-type-type-owner-owningObjectId-avatar-id-delete|
|Create dashboard|POST /rest/api/2/dashboard|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-dashboard-post|
|Get dashboard|GET /rest/api/2/dashboard/{id}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-dashboard-id-get|
|Get Jira attachment settings|GET /rest/api/2/attachment/meta|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-attachment-meta-get|
|Get fields|GET /rest/api/2/field|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-field-get|
|Get custom field option|GET /rest/api/2/customFieldOption/{id}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-customField-fieldId-option-post|
|Get issue picker suggestions|GET /rest/api/2/issue/picker|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-issue-picker-get|
|Get issue security level|GET /rest/api/2/securitylevel/{id}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-securitylevel-id-get|
|Get alternative issue types|GET /rest/api/2/issuetype/{id}/alternatives|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-issuetype-id-alternatives-get|
|Analyse Jira expression|POST /rest/api/2/expression/analyse|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-expression-analyse-post|
|Evaluate Jira expression|POST /rest/api/2/expression/eval|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-expression-eval-post|
|Get global settings|GET /rest/api/2/configuration|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-configuration-get|
|Get field reference data|GET /rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-group-JQL|
|Get field auto complete suggestions|GET /rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-jql-autocompletedata-get|
|Parse JQL query|POST /rest/api/2/jql/parse|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-jql-autocompletedata-suggestions-get|
|Get locale|GET /rest/api/2/mypreferences/locale|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-mypreferences-locale-get|
|Get my permissions|GET /rest/api/2/mypermissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-mypermissions-get|
|Get bulk permissions|POST /rest/api/2/permissions/check|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-permissions-check-post|
|Get permitted projects|POST /rest/api/2/permissions/project|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-permissions-project-post|
|Get component issues count|GET /rest/api/2/component/{id}/relatedIssueCounts|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-component-id-relatedIssueCounts-get|
|Validate project key|GET /rest/api/2/projectvalidate/key|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-projectvalidate-key-get|
|Get valid project key|GET /rest/api/2/projectvalidate/validProjectKey|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-projectvalidate-validProjectKey-get|
|Get valid project nameGET /rest/api/2/projectvalidate/validProjectName|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-projectvalidate-validProjectName-get|
|Get all project types|GET /rest/api/2/project/type|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-project-type-get|
|Get project type by key|GET /rest/api/2/project/type/{projectTypeKey}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-project-type-projectTypeKey-get|
|Get Jira instance info|GET /rest/api/2/serverInfo|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-serverInfo-get|
|Find users assignable to projects|GET /rest/api/2/user/assignable/multiProjectSearch|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-user-assignable-multiProjectSearch-get|
|Get all statuses|GET /rest/api/2/status|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-status-get|
|Get status|GET /rest/api/2/status/{idOrName}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-status-idOrName-get|

These endpoints are referred to the V2 of the API, but the V3 endpoints that match with these also have the same open permissions

I would like to Suggest that admins be given the ability to require that all REST API access be authenticated with the instance to prevent anonymous data mining. This could be done as a global setting. This would allow admins to disable it if it interferes with any apps.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to require authentication to get output from REST API endpoints

fields.description:

fields.description:

Copying a value from one field to another is very helping in avoiding repetitive task. However Component fields cannot copy the name, instead it shows the ID of the value

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule to copy the value from Components field to Labels field
 !copy_value.png|thumbnail!

Field name value should be copied correctly

h3. Actual Results
The field is copy, however it's the Id of the field that is the result
||Components || Labels||
| !component.png|thumbnail!  | !labels.png|thumbnail!  |

Confirmed this by looking at the REST call https://your-instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/AT2-76489
*Output*
{code}
"components":[{"self":"https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/component/10021","id":"10021","name":"Public website"}]
{code}

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
It would be nice if a User Group field can be available in Automation rule, whereby users can be added to this field and created in Automation rule settings and can be used in subsequent Automation features which involves users.


E.g. Adding Watchers to Issues

In such a case, when this group is added, the members belonging to that group are unpacked and subsequently added individually to the Watchers field.
fields.summary: Ability to "Add watchers" to a group of users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a site has multiple Jira products (ie Jira Software + Jira Core) and a user visits a page in one of them then both products "Last seen on" is set to the same date.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Give the user Jira Core access only in an instance that has both Jira Core and Jira Software
 # Login as the user
 # Visit an Jira software board page only
 # Check the "Last seen on" date in site admin

h3. Expected Results

"Last seen on" date is only updated for Jira Software
h3. Actual Results

"Last seen on" date is updated both Jira Core and Jira Software with the same date
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Last seen on" date is updated even when the user does not have product access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you configure a custom field (pick multiple users) to receive a notification, only the first user showed on the custom field will receive the notification. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field to pick multiple users;
# Associate to a screen.
# Add that field to the notification scheme, for example, when an issue is commented.
# Add some users to that field on an issue.
# Make a comment on that issue.

h3. Expected Results
All users should receive the notification.

h3. Actual Results
Only the first user receives a notification.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, you could use a different option to receive notifications as a watcher or something like that and it will work properly.
fields.summary: Custom field (pick multiple users) is not receiving notifications

When trying to export issues via CSV, "Status Category" field is not exported. This column is not shown in csv file.

fields.description: Currently, you can only customize a Jira instance with one text color and one sidebar color. It would be great to have the ability to further customize the text by adding an option to use two colors. Right now, if text is set to white, and the 'Create' button is set to white, it's not possible to read the text on the button.

fields.description:

When you try to add some users to teams using the @mention feature, it displays nothing. This doesn't affect all users, I was able to find some users using the @mention on my test instance.

 # Head over to People page

The users appear in the drop-down list as a result
h3. Actual Results

Returns nothing instead

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When try to impersonate a user using other languages rather than English, the switch back button is missed, for example, *Danish* and *Spanish*. So, the user that is impersonating must log off and login every time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ask for a user to change the language to *Dansk/Danish on profile settings > account preferences*.
 # Try to impersonate that user.

h3. Expected Results
The switch back button should appear.

h3. Actual Results
The switch back button is missed.


h3. Workaround
Ask for the user to use another language.
fields.summary: Switch back button missed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a sub-tasks with required fields shows a pop-up warning but not the create sub-task form to complete with the required fields on Mac App

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have custom fields marked as required for a sub-tasks
# Access the Story and attempt to create a sub-task
# A pop-up will be displayed that there are required fields but the form does not open to complete the operation

h3. Expected Results
The form to complete the required fields should be displayed to complete the sub-task creation

h3. Actual Results
A pop-up will be displayed that there are required fields but the form does not open to complete the operation

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a sub-tasks with required fields shows a pop-up warning but not the create sub-task form to complete with the required fields on Mac App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting a Workflow to an XML file, the description of the *Status* or action is not included.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a description to any status in the Workflow
 # Export to XML

h3. Expected Results

XML file should include status name, status description and status id.
{code}
    <step id="10" name="Pending">
      <meta name="jira.description">Testing description from status PENDING</meta>
      <meta name="jira.status.id">10079</meta>
    </step>
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The status description is excluded from the file.
{code}
    <step id="10" name="Pending">
      <meta name="jira.status.id">10079</meta>
{code}

h3. Workaround

As a workaround you can add the *jira.i18n.title* property key and add the description wanted as the value which gives you similar results.

{code}
      <meta name="jira.i18n.title">Testing description from status PENDING</meta>
{code}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
(i) [Workflow Properties - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/workflow-properties-776636709.html]
{panel}
fields.summary: Description not exported for statuses in XML Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently, it's not possible to re-arrange/re-order modules supplied by third-party apps
 !Screenshot 2020-04-05 at 23.58.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* As with custom fields - give modules supplied by third-party(externally hosted) app vendors the ability to be re-arranged/re-ordered on the issue view layout settings

h3. Why this is important
* Other fields/field types are able to be moved or re-arranged
* Customers may need to have the third-party app(externally hosted) features at the top of the view issue screen  
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Make it possible to re-arrange externally hosted/third-party app modules on the field layout screen

fields.description:
Jira should have a separate settings to manage the in-app Jira notifications and for email notifications. 
Currently, both notifications are managed from the personal settings which is also used for email notifications.
In this way, we cannot manage email notifications separately than of in-app Jira notification panel.
fields.summary: Should have a separate settings for managing in-app notifications.
